ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Psyc 627 explored how psychological processes form in infants. It teaches infant methodology while looking at a multitude of psychological phenomena in infants. I would recommend this class but only if it is the only class you take because it's a lot of work and a very small group (so you can't get out of doing the reading ever).
Yes. If you are at all interested in infant cognition, or in developmental psychology or cognitive science, this would be a very good course.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It taught me a lot of methods and piqued my interest in the development of gender, a topic that I think I will pursue in the future.

The course deepened my understanding of psychology by providing me with a broad grounding in the research in infant cognition. This will be highly informative for my own research as I move forward both in the methods employed and in the theoretical underpinnings covered.Additionally, the weekly responses provided a chance to think through the material critically and even propose new infant studies.
